section.name: Translate Messages
section.p: Jetspeed2 has the translatable messages in Java properties and XML files

subsection.name: Properties File
subsection.p: This document shows how to create a message properties file for your language.
*_en.properties is English message properties file. You can use it as a base properties file for your language.
If you use UNIX system, you can use find command to find the properties files:
subsection.source: $ cd ${jetspeed-2-home} $ find . -type f | grep -v CVS | grep _en.properties
subsection.p: To translate messages, copy the properties file for your language. For more information about Language, Country and Variant code, see "JavaDoc: Locale Class", "ISO Language Code" and "ISO Country Code".
subsection.h5: 3. Translate *_<your language, [country and variant]>.properties.orig in your language
subsection.p: For more information about a properties file, see "JavaDoc: Properties Class".

Since the properties file is assumed to be using the ISO 8859-1 character encoding, use native2ascii command to convert to ISO 8859-1. For more information about "native2ascii(Solaris)" or "native2ascii(Windows)".
subsection.h5: 5. Build & Deploy Jetspeed2, and see if your translation is displayed
subsection.p: For more information about Jetspeed 2 build and deploy steps, see "Getting Started".
subsection.h5: 6. Create a new JIRA issue, and attach *_<your language, [country and variant]>.properties
subsection.p: JIRA site for Jetspeed 2 is http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/BrowseProject.jspa?id=10492. To create a new JIRA issue, go to "CREATE NEW ISSUE"(select "l10n" as Component/s name).
